page.title: 12Village Changes
page.content: In many ways the village of Swimbridge has changed tremendously duriny the last century but there is much which has altered little. The greatest changes seem to have occured during the last twenty years. Mrs.{Pam Hutchings}is in her early forties and lives opposite the Jack Russell pub at Bridge View. For many years she was the cleaner-in-charge at the local school where she still works as a meal-time supervisor. She has seen many changes including the closure of the railway line in 1966 and an enormous increase in the volume of road traffic although she feels the roads have been improved. The tannery has also closed as has the Coach and Houses. The population has changed, she feels, with few of the original families remaining although there are more young families at the moment.
